intro: Phyllanthus arenarius var. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan sandpearl, is a flowering plant native to southwestern China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions and has adapted to survive in harsh climates. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
